The most legit jobs are traditional 9–5 jobs that are offered by the company as a remote job. That means you’re getting the same pay, benefits as a traditional full time worker. If you want to avoid the hustle of freelance or starting your own business these are the best options for you. There are thousands of online jobs that are legit at companies that might not be household names (Trello, Zapier, Buffer, Github), and those that are more familiar (Kaplan, Aetna, Amazon). There are companies that have a headquarters and allow remote work, and companies that are fully 100% remote, which means everyone from the CEO to admin are remote workers. These companies also have rad benefits. Mapillary is a good example of a company with an HQ but offers remote work as an option. Here’s how they describe their team: We've got our headquarters in Malmö, Sweden, but work with a remote team. Today we have colleagues in Barcelona, Graz, Los Angeles, New York, Stockholm, and Zagreb. As a team, we work distributed, and people work where they want when they want. GitHub, Google Drive, Hangouts, and Slack are our main tools. We ship early, in the open, and make multiple releases every day.
